lead_paragraph: Some towns began to let residents in to inspect their flood-ravaged homes even as residents flanking the Mississippi River farther south in Missouri and Illinois evacuated.

byline.contributor: Austin Huguelet reported from Pacific, and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By AUSTIN HUGUELET and JACK HEALY

headline.print_headline: St. Louis Area Surveys Toll as Flood Risk Shifts South
headline.main: St. Louis Area Surveys Toll as Flood Risk Shifts South

snippet: Some towns began to let residents in to inspect their flood-ravaged homes even as residents flanking the Mississippi River farther south in Missouri and Illinois evacuated.
abstract: Floodwaters slowly drain away outside St Louis and highways are reopened, allowing residents who fled area to return and survey damage to their homes and properties; overall death toll from flooding in Missouri rises to 22.
